ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: - Japanese conversation in business scenarios - Discussing current events in Japanese

It's a very exclusive class experience that we only have 5 students in the class. This unique time and space gave us great opportunities to practice spoken Japanese and ask questions. And I enjoyed a lot the learning materials using in this class: Videos, readings and audios.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: - Topics of the class are current - The pace of the class is too slow - Watching and discussing TV dramas in class is not so interesting. We always run out of things to say - Would appreciate individual feedback directly from the instructor

The homework is extremely important, most of the classes we were checking the contents of the homework. I hope we could have more time for free speech and discuss with topics named by students. It might be a new way to both learn Japanese language and also know more about studies in other schools of Yale.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are willing to improve your spoken Japanese in Yale, this class is high recommended. It is only a small portion of the official writing in this class. But, definitely best teachers with great sense of responsibility, they are committed to help your study with 100% effort.
